result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Beth Ann Debolt

records.addlTxt: Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; DEBOLT REPORT
Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services

Defendant Beth Ann Debolt appeared by video.  Attorney Maryann Corea appeared by video for Beth Ann Debolt.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense raises competency pursuant to Wisc. Stat. 971.14(3).  Court suspends proceedings and ordered defendant be examined by the Forensic Unit. Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Beth Ann Debolt in court, in custody.  Attorney Maryann Corea in court for Beth Ann Debolt.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests additional pretrial conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Violation (New Criminal Charges) Report
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with CKD, his residence or anywhere else he temporarily occupies
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Beth Ann Debolt in court with attorney Maryann Corea.  Defendant Beth Ann Debolt in custody.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Beth Ann Debolt appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Skwierawski, Branch 41.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
